Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a pale-orange pottery vessel, the fabric is partially grey in section and relatively coarse, the exterior is covered with a darker slip and faint traces of three lines of Coptic text written in black ink.
Curator's comments: To be published by J. Cromwell
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393232) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393232)
